intro: Monotes caloneurus var. dawei, commonly known as the Guangxi monotes, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to southern China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, typically in mountainous regions with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
